summary: This is an internal timeline memorandum detailing the events leading up to the death of Jeffrey Epstein in the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) on August 10, 2019. It chronicles his placement on and removal from suicide watch, his cellmate situation, and the final hours before he was found unresponsive in his cell.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The central subject of the document; details his condition, interactions, and ultimate death in custody at the Metropolitan Correctional Center.

persons.name: Unit Manager
persons.context: Reportedly gave Epstein a telephone call on the evening of August 9, 2019, and described him as being in good spirits.

persons.name: Officer
persons.context: Multiple officers are mentioned conducting counts and checks; one officer reported failing to conduct official counts, and another refused to discuss the matter.

connections.description: The Unit Manager interacted with Epstein, giving him a phone call and reporting on his demeanor.
Correctional officers were responsible for monitoring Epstein, conducting counts, and discovering him unresponsive.

events.title: Epstein Found in Fetal Position
events.description: Epstein was found in a fetal position in his cell, breathing but unresponsive initially. His neck was red. He was placed on suicide watch and received a medical evaluation.

events.title: Epstein Removed from Suicide Watch
events.description: The Psychology Services Department removed Epstein from suicide watch after daily interactions. He was returned to the Special Housing Unit with a cellmate.

events.title: Cellmate Released, Epstein Alone
events.description: Epstein's cellmate was released from court to the community and did not return. Epstein was in a legal visit all day and was returned to a cell with no cellmate, contrary to his required PSYCH Alert status.

events.title: Evening Phone Call
events.description: The Unit Manager gave Epstein a telephone call in the evening. Epstein was reported to be in good spirits and nothing unusual was noted.

events.title: Failed Counts and Checks
events.description: An officer reported failing to conduct the 3am and 5am official counts. When asked about 30-minute checks, the officer did not respond. A second officer refused to discuss the matter.

events.title: Epstein Found Unresponsive and Pronounced Dead
events.description: Staff found Epstein unresponsive in his cell during breakfast service. CPR was initiated. He was moved to Health Services, EMS arrived, and he was transported to a hospital where he was pronounced dead. Bruising was reported around his neck and an orange makeshift noose was found in the cell.

locations: Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) (inferred as the institution)
keyFacts: Jeffrey Epstein was found unresponsive in his cell on the morning of August 10, 2019, and was pronounced dead at the hospital.
Epstein had been on suicide watch from July 23 but was removed on July 29 by the Psychology Services Department.
On August 9, Epstein's cellmate was released and did not return, leaving Epstein alone in his cell overnight despite a PSYCH Alert requiring a cellmate.
Correctional officers failed to conduct mandatory 3am and 5am counts on the night of Epstein's death, and one officer refused to discuss the matter.
An orange makeshift noose and bruising around Epstein's neck were reported after his body was discovered.
